intro: Acetosella abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian sorrel, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the high altitudes of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soil. Its foliage is edible and has been traditionally used in local cuisines for its tart flavor. Acetosella abyssinica also plays a role in soil stabilization and supports local biodiversity in its native habitat.
